thread.title: Sixers' rally to top Cavs on last-second shot
thread.title_full: Sixers' rally to top Cavs on last-second shot

title: Sixers' rally to top Cavs on last-second shot
text:
Bob Cooney, Daily News Sports Columnist Posted: Friday, October 9, 2015, 3:01 AM 
Brett Brown said that he would look at the month of October as training camp for his 76ers. In that regard, it is very early to draw any conclusions after two preseason games. But, in political talk, the early returns aren't very encouraging. 
But a huge second half comeback and a three-pointer with 1.3 seconds remaining by Scottie Wilbekin made the sloppy performance a little easier to swallow, as the Sixers pulled out a 115-114 win. 
As was the case Tuesday in Washington, the opponent, this time the Cleveland Cavaliers, got more open shots than contested ones and ran the floor with ease, especially in the first half. But the Sixers did hold them to only 49 points in the second half. 
Though without LeBron James, Kyrie Irving and Kevin Love, the Cavs torched the Sixers for 65 points in the first half, while making 54 percent of their shots. More coverage
